title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 26.4 - Books and records
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 26.4 - Books and records

State Regulations

Each holder of an AP permit shall keep and maintain upon
the premises designated in said permit, adequate books and records of all
transactions involving the purchase and use of such alcohol, which shall show
the amount of alcohol purchased by such permittee and the size of the
containers in which the same was received by said permittee, together with the
names, permit numbers and places of business of the persons from whom the same
was purchased, and the amount involved in each purchase; such records shall be
kept in addition to any records required by the United States Government under
any Federal permit that may be held by such permittee. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
26.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
